summary:
Here is a clear and concise summary of the Security Council document:

The Security Council welcomes the report of the Secretary-General on the UN operation in Cyprus and reiterates its call to address the humanitarian issue of missing persons. The Council notes the stable security situation on the island and urges both sides to avoid actions that could increase tension. 

The Council extends the mandate of UNFICYP until 15 December 2006, expressing full support for its mandate in the buffer zone. It calls on the Turkish Cypriot side and Turkish forces to restore the military status quo in Strovilia and encourages active participation in bicommunal discussions. 

The Council requests a report on implementation of this resolution by 1 December 2006 and welcomes efforts to implement the Secretary-General's zero-tolerance policy on sexual exploitation and abuse. 

The Council reaffirms all its relevant resolutions on Cyprus and decides to remain seized of the matter.
